title: Why do people write a question and then answer it themselves? - Quora

response.answer_text: We all should ask ourselves questions. And I am sure most of us do, in our own little minds. Asking a question publicly, then answering it publicly, somehow gives it a greater reality. It makes it a little more powerful. It makes it a little more real. It confirms one’s view, position or opinion to one’s self. Even if no one else actually reads it. It’s still out there in the world.

Why do people write a question and then answer it themselves? I can’t tell if you mean in day to day life, or specifically here on Quora. Day to day life. Some people talk to themselves, or think out loud. I find it slightly distracting, depending upon how animated that activity is, but as I periodically engage in it myself, I don’t really judge it harshly.On Quora. I don’t know, I find the practice self-indulgent in the extreme.
